ingredients: Split green gram with skin (chilkewali moong dal) soaked 1 cup, Rice parboiled, soaked 1 cup, Dried red chillies 2-3, Green chillies roughly chopped 2-3, Onions roughly chopped 2 medium, Ginger roughly chopped 1 inch pie, Salt to taste, Curry leaves 8-10, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons, White sesame seeds roasted 1 1/2 tablespoons, Peanuts 2-3 tablespoons, Black peppercorns 8-10, Cumin seeds 1 1/2 tablespoons, Oil to fry
instructions:
1. Drain and coarsely grind moong daal and parboiled rice with dried red chillies, green chillies, onions, ginger and salt.
2. Transfer the mixture into a bowl. Add curry leaves, coriander leaves and white sesame seeds and mix.
3. Coarsely grind peanuts, black peppercorns and cumin seeds and add to the bowl and mix well.
4. Add a little water to get the required consistency and mix.
5. Heat a non stick tawa and drizzle a little oil on it.
6. Put a ladle full of batter on it and spread into a thin pancake.
7. Drizzle a little all around and cook, turning sides, till both sides become golden brown and crisp. Serve hot.

name: Vankaya Perugesi
ingredients: Small brinjals 6-7, Yogurt 4 tablespoons, Salt to taste, Oil 2-3 tablespoons, Curry leaves 18-20, Garlic paste 1 teaspoon, Ginger paste 1 teaspoon, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoon, Onions finely chopped 2 medium, Gram flour (besan) 1 tablespoon, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Slit brinjals into four keeping them joined at the stem. Add salt and set aside.
2. Heat oil in a non stick pan, add onions, curry leaves, garlic paste and ginger paste and sauté till fragrant.
3. Add red chilli powder and salt and mix well.
4. Whisk yogurt and gram flour in a bowl till smooth.
5. Add turmeric powder and whisk again.
6. Wash the brinjals and add to the pan with a little water and cook for 2-3 minutes.
7. Add yogurt mixture and mix well.
8. Cover and cook on low heat for 3-4 minutes or till the brinjals are well done. Serve hot.

name: Vankaya Poornam
ingredients: Baby brinjals 10-12, Tamarind pulp 2 tablespoons, For stuffing: Cumin seeds 1 teaspoon, Coriander seeds 1 tablespoon, White sesame seeds 1 1/2 tablespoons, Dried red chillies 2-3, Poppy seeds (khuskhus/posto) 1 tablespoon, Garlic crushed 2-3 cloves, Onion chopped 1 medium, Desiccated coconut 2 tablespoons, Oil 3 tablespoons, Curry leaves 6-8, Salt to taste
instructions:
1. To make the stuffing, heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin, coriander and sesame seeds along with red chillies and sauté for 1 minute.
2. Add poppy seeds, garlic, onion and sauté till lightly browned. Meanwhile remove the stalk of the brinjals and make 2 slits in the shape of a cross mark, stopping just about halfway through.
3. Take the pan off the heat and add the desiccated coconut and mix. Put the pan back on heat and sauté for 1 minute. Switch off the heat, add tamarind pulp, curry leaves and salt and mix well.
4. Let it cool slightly, then grind with a little water to a smooth paste. Stuff this mixture into the slits of the brinjals. Heat the remaining oil in a non-stick frying pan and rotate the pan so that the oil coats the entire pan.
5. Place the stuffed brinjals in the pan and cook on high heat for a minute so that the brinjal skin gets crisp.
6. Add a little water, cover and cook till the brinjals are completely cooked. Serve hot.

name: Baingan Saaswe
ingredients: Brinjals roasted 1 large, Thick buttermilk 1 cup, Mustard seeds 1 teaspoon, Coconut scraped 1/2 cup, Garlic 3-4 cloves, Salt to taste, Green chillies 5, Oil 2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Roast the brinjal, peel and mash. Grind three red chillies, half the mustard seeds, coconut, garlic and salt with a little water to a fine paste. Add the buttermilk and a little salt to the brinjal and mix. Add the ground masala and mix.
2. Heat oil in a small pan. Add the remaining mustard seeds. When they splutter add the remaining red chillies, broken into smaller pieces. Add to the brinjal mixture and cover immediately to trap the flavours.
3. Mix well and serve.

name: Andhra Style Chicken Pulao
ingredients: Chicken Cut into 12 pieces on the bone 750 grams, Basmati Rice soaked 1 1/2 cups, Onions 2 medium, Oil 3 tablespoons, Cinnamon one inch sticks 2-3, Cloves 5-6, Green cardamoms 5, Star anise 1, Curry leaves 15-20, Dried red chillies 3-4, Garlic 15-20, Ginger 1 1/2 inch piece, Water 2 tablespoons, Green chillies 4, Salt to taste, Coconut milk 1 cup, Chicken stock 2 cups, Lemon 1
instructions:
1. Slice onions. Heat oil in a deep non stick pan and add cinnamon, cloves, green cardamoms, star anise, curry leaves and onions and sauté till golden.
2. Grind red chillies, garlic, ginger with 2 tbsps water to a fine paste. Slit green chillies and add to the pan and continue to sauté. Add chicken and salt and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add ground paste and mix well. Drain rice and add along with coconut milk, chicken stock and cook on high heat. When the mixture begins to boil, reduce heat and add juice of 1 lemon.
4. Mix well, cover and cook till both the rice and chicken are done. Take the pan off the heat and let it stand, covered, till it is time to serve. Serve hot.

name: Andhra Avakkai Recipe
ingredients: Raw Mangoes 12 medium, Mustard Seeds, Mustard seeds 1 cup, Red chilli powder (deghi mirch) 2 cups, Salt 1 1/2 cups, Turmeric powder 1/4 cups, Asafoetida 1/4 tablespoon, Fenugreek seeds (methi dana) 4 tablespoons, Sesame oil (til oil) 2 cups
instructions:
1. Select good, firm and sour mangoes. Wash thoroughly and wipe them completely dry with an absorbent kitchen cloth. Cut mangoes into half with the seed and then cut each half into six to eight equal pieces.
2. Spread pieces on a mat and dry in the sun for at least two days. Clean and dry mustard seeds in sun and pound to a coarse powder.
3. Thoroughly mix red chilli powder, turmeric powder, salt, asafetida powder, mustard powder, fenugreek seeds and oil. Remove seeds from the sun dried mango pieces and mix them with the pickle mixture.
4. Wipe chana to remove the superficial dust and add to the mixture. Transfer to a ceramic pickle jar, tie the mouth with a muslin cloth and keep in the sun for three days without stirring.
5. From the fourth day onwards, stir the pickle well and continue to keep in the sun for at least a week to ten days. This pickle will last for a year if kept well.

name: Spicy Bhindi Andhra Style
ingredients: Ladyfingers trimmed 250 glass, Shallots 4 tablespoons, Shallots 20-25, Coriander seeds 2 teaspoons, Cumin seeds 1 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Dried red chillies 7-8, Roasted peanuts peeled 1/4 cup, Garlic 5-6 cloves
instructions:
1. Heat oil in a non stick pan. In another non stick pan dry roast coriander seeds, cumin seeds.
2. Add shallots to the oil in the pan and saute for 2 minutes. Add ladyfingers and salt and mix well. Cover and cook.
3. Add red chillies to the roasting spices and continue to roast till fragrant. Transfer into a blender jar, add roasted peanuts and garlic and crush coarsely.
4. Cook ladyfingers, stirring occasionally, till done. Add the crushed masala and mix well.
5. Serve hot.

name: Pumpkin Curry Recipe
ingredients: Red Pumpkin 250 grams, Fresh Coconut Grated grated 4 tablespoons, Mustard seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Garlic 4 cloves, Oil 2 tablespoons, Curry leaves 7-8, Onion, chopped 1 medium, Salt to taste, Turmeric powder 1/4 teaspoon, Green chilli slit 4, Coconut milk 1 cup, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoon, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespoon
instructions:
1. Grind the coconut, mustard seeds and garlic to a fine paste. Heat the oil in a pressure cooker; add the curry leaves. When they begin to change colour, add the onion and sauté till pink. Add the pumpkin, salt and turmeric powder and sauté for two or three minutes.
2. Add the slit green chillies and coconut milk and bring to a boil. Seal the cooker with the lid and cook over medium heat till the pressure is released once (one whistle).
3. The pumpkin should be completely cooked and tender. Remove the lid when the pressure has reduced completely. Add the ground paste and chilli powder and mix well. Simmer for three or four minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Artekai Pappu Recipe
ingredients: Split pigeon pea soaked 1 cup, Raw banana 1 inch cubes 2, Split Bengal gram (chana dal) roasted 2 teaspoons, Coriander seeds roasted 2 teaspoons, Black peppercorns 6-8, Coconut scraped 2 teaspoons, Dried red chillies 4, Tamarind pulp 2 tablespoons, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Oil 2 teaspoons, Mustard seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Cumin seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Curry leaves 6-8, Asafoetida 1 a pinch, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespoon
instructions:
1. Pressure cook pigeon peas with raw bananas and two cups of water till three whistles are given out.
2. Grind roasted Bengal grams, coriander seeds, black peppercorns, coconut, red chillies with tamarind pulp to a smooth paste.
3. Take a deep pan and mix together boiled pigeon peas, ground paste, turmeric powder and salt. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
4. As they begin to splutter add cumin seeds, curry leaves and asafoetida. Pour tempering over the dal and add fresh coriander.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil on high heat, stirring constantly. Adjust consistency. Cook for two minutes. Serve hot with rice.

name: Pumpkin More Kozhambu Recipe
ingredients: Pumpkin cut into batons 1 cup, Yogurt 2 cups, Salt to taste, Green chillies 4, Coriander seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Cumin seeds 1/4 teaspoon, Toor dal 1/2 teaspoon, Split Bengal gram (chana dal) 1 teaspoon, Rice 1 teaspoon, Coconut scraped 1/2 cup, Curry leaves 20, Fresh coconut 1/4 cup, Oil 4 tablespoons, Mustard seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Whole dry red chillies 2, Carom seeds (ajwain) 1/4 teaspoon, Fenugreek seeds (methi dana) 1/4 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Parboil the pumpkin batons with little salt, drain and reserve. Soak the dals and rice for about 5 minutes. Grind to a smooth paste with the green chillies, jeera, coriander seeds, coconut and half the quantity of curry leaves. Wash and chop the fresh coriander.
2. Churn the yogurt with 200 ml. water. Add salt and whisk the ground paste into it thoroughly. Heat a vessel, add the yogurt mixture, stirring continuously and bring to boil. Reduce the heat, add finely chopped coriander, remaining curry leaves and simmer till it thickens.
3. Add the cooked pumpkin in the end. Heat oil and temper with mustard seeds, red chillies and ajwain. Pour the tempering over the yogurt curry and cover.
4. TIP: Use slightly soured yogurt to get a tasty and tangy curry. Ajwain not only enhances the flavor of this preparation but also aids in easy digestion.

name: Kadugu Maangai Recipe
ingredients: Raw mangoes small and tender 1/2 kilograms, Salt 4 tablespoons, Powdered sugar 2 tablespoons, Red chilli powder 5 tablespoons, Mustard powder 1 tablespoon, Oil 4 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Wash, peel and cut mangoes into half. Put mangoes in a jar. Add salt and sugar and put them in the sun for four to five days When the mangoes have absorbed all the salt and sugar, add red chilli powder and mustard powder and mix well.
2. Heat oil to smoking point. Take off the heat and let it cool completely. Add the oil to the mangoes. Mix well. Store the above in an airtight container.

name: Coconut Khara Kozhambu
ingredients: Baby Brinjal 16-20, Sambar Onion 6-8 tablespoons, Onion 1 medium, Curry leaves 10-12, Tamarind 2 lemon sized ball, Mustard seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) 1 teaspoon, Asafoetida 1/4 cup, Salt to taste, FOR MASALA PASTE: Split Bengal gram (chana dal) 2 teaspoons, Whole dry red chillies 6 whole pods, Coconut scraped 1/2 cup, Cloves 4, Poppy seed (khuskhus) paste 1 tablespoon
instructions:
1. Wash brinjals and wipe them dry. Slit them into four without separating, keeping the stem intact. Sauté in two tablespoons of oil till three fourth done. Peel, wash and slice onion finely. Wash curry leaves and pat them dry.
2. Soak tamarind in two cups of warm water, remove the pulp, strain and keep aside Heat two tablespoons of oil in a pan and roast all the ingredients for the masala paste till light brown. Cool and grind to a smooth paste with little water. Heat remaining oil in a kadai, temper with mustard seeds, urad dal, asafoetida and curry leaves. Add sliced onion and fry till it becomes transparent.
3. Add the tamarind pulp, salt, masala paste and fry for a minute. Add one cup of water and bring to boil. Continue cooking for another five minutes. Add the fried brinjals and simmer till it thickens. Serve hot with steamed rice or chapati.

name: Chenai Podutuval Recipe
ingredients: yam 6-8, Coconut to taste, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Green chillies 4-5, Coconut,scraped 1/2, Oil 2 tablespoons, Mustard seeds 1 teaspoon, Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) 1 1/2 teaspoons, Curry leaves 8-10, Whole dry red chillies 2-3, Tamarind pulp 1 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Wash, clean and cut the yam into medium sized pieces. Pressure-cook the yam with salt and turmeric. Keep aside.
2. Grind the coconut and green chillies to a coarse paste. Keep aside.Heat the oil and season it with curry leaves, dry red chillies, mustard seeds and split black gram.
3. When the mustard seeds start to splutter add the cooked yam pieces, the coconut paste and ½ a cup of water. Cover and simmer on slow heat. Lastly add the tamarind pulp and cook till the vegetables till dry.
4. Serve hot.

name: Guntur Chilli Kodi Recipe
ingredients: Chicken 1 medium, Yogurt 1 inch piece, Garlic 10 cloves, Curry leaves 2 sprigs, Guntur red chillies whole 10, Rice 2 tablespoons, Lemon juice 2 tablespoons, Yogurt 1/2 cup, Oil to shallow fry, Refined flour (maida) 1/2 cup, Fresh coriander leaves a few sprigs
instructions:
1. Clean and cut chicken into four pieces. Make deep slits on the meat. Grind ginger, garlic, curry leaves, red chillies and rice to a smooth paste by adding some lemon juice.
2. Mix this paste with yogurt and the remaining lemon juice. Add salt to taste. Apply this marinade on the chicken thoroughly. Rest in the refrigerator for about an hour.
3. Heat oil in a pan. Dust the chicken pieces with refined flour and shallow fry till brown and crisp. Place the chicken in a vessel, sprinkle with two tablespoons of water and chopped coriander leaves and close with a tight lid.
4. Keep this on burning charcoal, with a few charcoals on the lid also. Cook for about fifteen to twenty minutes, open the lid and serve immediately.

name: Karela Andhra Style Recipe
ingredients: Bitter gourds 4-5, Tomato Puree 4, Ginger 1 inch piece, Garlic 5 cloves, Salt to taste, Coriander seeds 1 tablespoon, Cumin seeds 1 teaspoon, White sesame seeds 1 teaspoon, Oil 1 1/2 teaspoon, Onions chopped 2 medium, Tomato puree 1/4 cup, Jaggery (gur) grated 2 tablespoons, Tamarind pulp 2 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Wash, scrape and cut karela in half, length wise, remove seeds and thinly slice. Apply salt and leave aside for ten to fifteen minutes. Wash with plenty of water, drain and squeeze out excess water.
2. Grind ginger and garlic to a fine paste. Roast red chillies, coriander seeds, cumin seeds and white sesame seeds on a medium hot tawa till light brown, stirring continuously.
3. Cool the mixture and then grind to a fine powder. Heat oil in a non-stick pan and add the karela and stir-fry for four to five minutes or slightly browned. Add chopped onions and stir-fry for three to four minutes.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and again stir-fry for one to two minutes. Add tomato puree and cook further for a few minutes. Add ground powder, grated jaggery, tamarind pulp and salt.
5. Stir well and add one cup of water and bring to a boil. Reduce to medium heat, cover and simmer for five minutes.

name: Ariselu Recipe
ingredients: Rice, Jaggery grated, Sesame seeds (til), Oil
instructions:
1. Pick, wash and soak the rice overnight. Drain the water and dry the rice on a cloth.
2. Make a fine powder of the rice in a blender and it should be slightly damp.
3. Add one cup of water to the grated jaggery and heat it in a pan on low heat till it becomes a thick syrup.
4. (A drop of the syrup dropped in a spoon of water should make noise and become lumpy and not melt).
5. Add the rice flour to it slowly and stir well and make sure that no lumps are formed.
6. Remove from the heat and when slightly cool make big lime size balls of it.
7. Heat oil in a thick bottom pan/wok. Pat each ball into a thin, round and flat disc on a banana leaf or a plastic sheet and dab it with a few sesame seeds.
8. Fry each one in oil on low heat till deep brown.
9. Drain. When cool store them. They last for more than two weeks.

name: Kakkarkai Pullusu Recipe
ingredients: Bitter Gourd 4-5 medium, Tomato Puree to taste, Ginger 1 inch piece, Garlic 5 cloves, Dry red chilies 4, Coriander seeds 1 tablespoon, Cumin seeds 1 teaspoon, White sesame seeds 1 teaspoon, Oil 1 1/2 teaspoon, Onions chopped 2 medium, Tomato puree 1/4 cup, Jaggery (gur) grated 2, Tamarind pulp 2 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Wash, scrape and cut karela in half, length wise, remove seeds and thinly slice. Apply salt and leave aside for ten to fifteen minutes. Wash with plenty of water, drain and squeeze out excess water.
2. Grind ginger and garlic to a fine paste. Roast red chillies, coriander seeds, cumin seeds and white sesame seeds on a medium hot tawa till light brown, stirring continuously.
3. Cool the mixture and then grind to a fine powder. Heat oil in a non-stick pan and add the karela and stir-fry for four to five minutes or slightly browned. Add chopped onions and stir-fry for three to four minutes.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and again stir-fry for one to two minutes. Add tomato puree and cook further for a few minutes. Add ground powder, grated jaggery, tamarind pulp and salt. Stir well and add one cup of water and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce to medium heat, cover and simmer for five minutes.

name: Andhra Chilli Chicken
ingredients: Chicken 1 (800 grams) medium, Dried Red Chillies 8-10, Salt to taste, Lemon juice 4 tablespoons, Ginger 2 inch piece, Garlic 6-8 cloves, Curry leaves 8-10, Rice 2 tablespoons, Yogurt 1/2 cup, Oil 1/2 cup, Refined flour (maida) 1/4 cup, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Cut the chicken into four pieces – two legs and two breasts. Make four to five half-inch deep slits on the chicken pieces. Apply the salt and two tablespoons of lemon juice and set aside.
2. Grind the ginger, garlic, curry leaves, dried red chillies and rice to a smooth paste with the remaining lemon juice. Add this paste to the yogurt and whisk well to a smooth consistency.
3. Add salt to taste. Apply this yogurt mixture liberally on the chicken pieces and leave to marinate for four to six hours, preferably in the refrigerator.
4. Heat the oil in a pan, roll the marinated chicken in the refined flour, shake off excess flour and add to the pan. Cook for one minute, turn over the chicken pieces and cook for another minute.
5. Reduce heat and cook for five to six minutes, turning the chicken pieces frequently for uniform cooking. Drain and transfer the chicken to a shallow pan and keep on medium heat.
6. Sprinkle the coriander leaves, two tablespoons water and cover with a fitting lid. Reduce heat and cook for five minutes on low heat or until the chicken is completely cooked.
7. Serve hot.

name: Avakkai Recipe
ingredients: Raw Mango 12 medium, Mustard Seeds 1 cup, Red chilli powder 2 cups, Salt 1 1/2 cup, Turmeric powder 1/4 cup, Asafoetida 1/4 teaspoon, Fenugreek seeds (methi dana) 4 tablespoons, Sesame oil (til oil) 2 cups
instructions:
1. Select good, firm and sour mangoes. Wash thoroughly and wipe them completely dry with an absorbent kitchen towel.
2. Cut the mangoes into half with the seed and then further cut each half in to six to eight equal sized pieces. Spread them on a mat and dry in the sun for about two days.
3. Clean and dry the mustard seeds and pound to a coarse powder. Thoroughly mix red chilli powder, turmeric powder, salt, asafoetida, mustard powder, fenugreek seeds and oil.
4. Remove seeds from the sun dried mango pieces and mix this with the pickle mixture. Transfer to a ceramic pickle jar, tie the mouth with a muslin cloth and keep in the sun for three days without stirring.
5. Fourth day onwards, stir the pickle well and continue to keep in the sun for at least a week to ten days. This pickle will last for a year if kept well.

name: Thakkali Pachadi
ingredients: Tomatoes chopped 2 small, Split Black Gram Skinless 1 teaspoon, Mustard seeds 1/4 teaspoon, Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) 1/4 teaspoon, Dried red chillies broken 3, Asafoetida 1 a pinch, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoon, Yogurt 1/2 cup, Salt Salt to taste
instructions:
1. Heat the oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds, split black grams, red chillies and asafoetida.
2. When the seeds begin to splutter add the tomatoes and red chili powder and sauté for about five minutes over a low heat.
3. Set aside to cool completely Add the yogurt and salt and mix well.
4. Serve cold.

name: Chicken Adai Recipe
ingredients: Boneless Chicken Breast 250 grams, Rice, parboiled 1/2 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Rice,parboiled 1/4 cup, Split Bengal gram (chana dal) 1/4 cup, Split pigeon pea (toor dal/arhar dal) 1/4 cup, Whole dry red chilli 6, Black peppercorns 5-6, Ginger peeled 1 inch piece, Garlic,peeled 10-12, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1/4 cup, Curry leaves chopped 10-12, Lemon 1/2 tablespoon, Oil to shallow fry
instructions:
1. Mince the chicken. Marinate with turmeric powder and a little salt.
2. Soak rice and dals for about twenty minutes. Drain and grind to a coarse batter with red chillies, peppercorns, ginger, garlic, fresh coriander leaves and curry leaves.
3. Mix the chicken into this batter. Adjust seasoning and stir in lemon juice. (The batter should be of dropping consistency, otherwise you can add a little water to adjust.)
4. Heat a tawa or griddle and smear with oil. Spread one ladle of the batter to about four to six diameter circle. Make a hole in the center with the spatula. Pour two tablespoons of oil around the edges and in the centre.
5. Cover with a lid and cook till the edges become crisp and turn golden brown. Turn over and pour some more oil and cook till the other side is crisp and light golden in colour. Serve hot.

name: Podi Mamsumu Recipe
ingredients: Mutton 1 1/2 inch pieces on the bone 500 grams, Yogurt 1 inch piece, Garlic 4-6 cloves, Yogurt 1 cup, Turmeric powder 1/4 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Guntur red chillies whole 8-10, Coriander seeds 2 tablespoons, Green cardamoms 4, Cinnamon 2 inch piece, Cloves 2-4, Black peppercorns 8-10, Poppy seeds (khuskhus/posto) 2 teaspoon, Oil 1/2 cup, Onions sliced 2 medium, Green chillies slit 3-4
instructions:
1. Grind ginger and garlic to a fine paste. Whisk yogurt with turmeric powder, ginger-garlic paste and salt. Marinate the mutton in this mixture for one hour.
2. Dry roast Guntur red chillies, coriander seeds, green cardamoms, cinnamon, cloves, black peppercorns and poppy seeds one by one on a tawa over medium heat. Cool, mix and grind to a fine powder. Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions till golden brown. Add green chillies and sauté for a minute. Add the marinated mutton and sauté on high heat for two minutes.
3. Add one cup water and ground spices and simmer on low heat till meat is tender and completely cooked. Continue cooking till all water dries up and oil surfaces. Serve hot with chapati or poori.

name: Bandaru Laddoo
ingredients: Gram Flour 2 cups, Oil 5 tablespoons, Ghee 1 tablespoon, Cashewnuts 15, Sugar 1 1/2 cups, Green cardamom powder 1 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Heat five tablespoons of oil and add to gram flour. Mix well and knead into a firm dough using enough water. Chop cashewnuts. Heat ghee, add chopped cashewnuts and fry till golden brown.
2. Drain onto an absorbent paper. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Using a murukku press, press the dough directly into the hot oil. Fry till golden brown. Drain onto an absorbent paper.
3. Use up all the dough similarly. Powder the fried murukkus and measure. Take equal measure of sugar and make a syrup of one thread consistency. Add the fried murukku powder, green cardamom powder and fried cashewnuts and mix well.
4. Take it off the heat. Smear ghee on your palms and shape into lemon sized laddoos. Cool and store.

name: Mysore Vadai Recipe
ingredients: Split Bengal gram soaked 1/2 cup, Split green gram skinless soaked 1/2 cup, Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) soaked 1/2 cup, Cashewnuts broken 8-10, Melon seeds (magaz) 1 tablespoon, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons, Curry leaves chopped 8-10, Ginger chopped 1 1/2 inch piece, Salt to taste, Oil for deep-frying
instructions:
1. Drain the soaked dals and grind them to a coarse paste without adding any water.
2. Remove the mixture into a bowl and add cashewnuts, melon seeds, coriander leaves, curry leaves, ginger and salt and mix well.
3. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai on medium heat. Drop spoonsful of mixture into the oil and deep fry till golden brown and crisp.
4. Drain on absorbent paper. Serve hot with coconut chutney.

name: Vegetable Rava Uppuma
ingredients: Semolina 1 1/2 cups, Green Peas 1/4 inch cubes 1 medium, French beans, 1/4 inch pieces 6-8, Cauliflower , small flotets 1 medium, Green peas 1/4 cup, Green capsicum, 1/4 inch pieces , seeded 1 medium, Salt to taste, Oil 5 tablespoons, Mustard seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Whole dry red chillies, broken 2, Split black gram skinless (dhuli urad dal) 2 teaspoons, Curry leaves 10-12, Green chillies, finely chopped 4, Onion , finely chopped 1 medium, Ginger, finely chopped 1 inch pieces, Asafoetida a pinch, Lemon juice 1 tablespoon
instructions:
1. Roast semolina in a dry kadai without browning. Set aside to cool.
2. Boil four cups of water in a deep pan, add little salt and boil carrot, beans, cauliflower and green peas for six to eight minutes or till the vegetables are almost done.
3. Drain and set the vegetables aside.

name: Pethe Ki Barfi
ingredients: Petha 250 grams, Khoya 250 grams, Sugar 125 grams, Saffron (kesar) 6-7 strands, Milk 1 tablespoon, Green cardamom powder 1/4 tablespoon, Pure ghee 1 tablespoon, Silver warq 1-2 sheet
instructions:
1. Grate the petha thickly. Cook on low heat till all the syrup dries up. Grease a thali. Knead the khoya till smooth.
2. Add sugar and the petha and cook on medium heat, stirring continuously till the mixture forms a mass. Add saffron dissolved in warm milk and green cardamom powder and mix well.
3. Pour the mixture into a greased tray and smoothen the surface. Cut into diamonds when cold. Decorate with silver warq and serve.

name: Kosha Mangsho
ingredients: Mutton , cut into 1 inch pieces on the bone 750 grams, Mustard oil 3 tablespoons, Potatoes , peeled and quartered 2 medium, Onion , chopped 1 large, Salt to taste, Cumin powder 1 teaspoon, Red chilli powder 1 1/2 teaspoons, Coriander powder 1 teaspoon, Ginger-garlic paste 1 tablespoon, Turmeric powder 1/4 teaspoon, Green chillies , slit 3, Fresh tomato puree 1 cup, Fresh coriander leaves , chopped 1 tablespoon+ for garnish, Luchi, Refined flour dough 200 grams, Oil to grease to deep fry
instructions:
1. Heat mustard oil in a deep non-stick pan till it smokes, add potatoes and fry till they turn a light brown.
2. Add onion, mix and sauté for a minute. Cover and cook till onion turns golden brown.
3. Take mutton pieces in a large bowl, add salt, cumin powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, ginger-garlic paste and turmeric powder, mix well and keep the bowl in the refrigerator to marinate for 1 hour if you have the time.
4. Add the marinated mutton to the pan and mix well.Add green chillies,mix, cover and cook on low heat for 8-10 minutes.
5. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
6. Add tomato puree and mix well. Add salt, cover and cook on low heat for 50-60 minutes or till mutton is fully done.
7. Divide the dough into small portions. Grease a worktop with some oil and roll out each portion into small luchis.
8. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Slide in the luchis, one at a time, and deep-fry till golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper.
9. Add coriander leaves to the mutton and mix well.
10. Transfer the mutton into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with luchis.

name: Koraishutir Kochuri with Cholar Dal
ingredients: Green peas , blanched and crushed 3/4 cup, Refined flour dough as required, Split Bengal gram (chana dal) , soaked and boiled 1 cup, Ghee 1 tablespoon, Fennel seeds (saunf) 1/2 teaspoon, Ginger , finely chopped 1 teaspoon, Green chillies , finely chopped 1/2 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Sugar 2 pinches, Cloves 4, Cinnamon 1/2 inch stick, Bay leaf 1, Cumin seeds 1/4 teaspoon, Fresh coconut , chopped 1 tablespoon, Turmeric powder 1/4 teaspoon, Raisins 12-16, Bengal gram stock 1 1/2 cups, Oil 1/2 tablespoon+ for deep frying, Dried red chillies , broken 1-2, Green chillies , slit 1-2
instructions:
1. To make the stuffing, heat ½ tablespoon ghee in a non-stick pan, add fennel seeds, ginger and green chillies, mix and sauté for 30 seconds.
2. Add green peas, salt and a pinch of sugar, mix and sauté till the moisture dries. Transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool.
3. Heat ½ tablespoon ghee in the same pan, add cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf, cumin seeds and coconut pieces, mix and sauté till the coconut turns light golden brown.
4. Add turmeric powder and Bengal gram and mix well. Add a pinch of sugar, salt and raisins and cook for a minute. AddBengal gram stock, mix and bring to a boil.
5. Heat ½ tablespoon oil in a small non-stick tempering pan, add dried red chillies and slit green chillies, sauté for 15 seconds and pour over the Bengal gram. Simmer for 4-5 minutes.
6. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
7. Divide the dough into equal portions and shape them into balls. Flatten each ball slightly and shape them into katoris, stuff each katori with some cooked green peas mixture, bring the edges together and seal taking care that the stuffing is completely covered and shape them into balls.
8. Apply a little oil on each stuffed ball and roll out into small discs. Slide the discs into hot oil and deep-fry in hot oil till golden brown and drain on absorbent paper.
9. Transfer the dal into a katori and arrange the kochuri on a serving plate and serve them hot.

name: Chhanar Payesh Recipe
ingredients: Buffalo milk 5 cups, Buffalo milk 1 litre, Lemon juice 2 tablespoons, Sugar 1/4 cup, Green cardamom powder 1/4 teaspoon, Pistachios , blanched, peeled and sliced 1 tablespoon, Almonds , blanched, peeled and sliced 1 tablespoon
instructions:
1. Boil 5 cups milk in a deep non-stick pan on low heat till it reduces and thickens.
2. Boil 1 litre milk in another deep non-stick pan. Switch the heat off, add lemon juice and stir till it curdles.
3. Strain through a muslin cloth kept over a strainer and immediately put the muslin cloth in ice cold water. Squeeze out excess water.
4. Transfer the chhana on a plate and mash with your hands.
5. Add sugar and cardamom powder to the reduced milk, mix well and cook till the sugar melts. Add pistachios and almonds, mix and switch off heat.
6. Scrape off the sides and bottom of the pan and mix with the milk, add chhana and mix well.
7. Transfer payesh into individual kasore and keep them in a refrigerator to chill.
8. Serve chilled.

name: Paneer Rezala Recipe
ingredients: Cottage cheese (paneer) cut into 1 inch cubes 400 grams, Ghee 1 1/2 teaspoons, Cinnamon 1 inch, Cloves 4-5, Black peppercorns 6-8, Bay leaf 1, Dried red chillies 2, Green cardamoms 2-3, Ginger-garlic paste 1/2 tablespoon, Medium onions pureed 2, Yogurt 3 tablespoons, Cashewnut paste 1/4 cup, Salt to taste, Sugar 1 pinch, Red chilli powder 1/2 teaspoon, Small green capsicums cut into squares 1, Small yellow capsicums cut into squares 1, Small red capsiucms cut into squares 1, Rose water 1 tablespoon, Fresh coriander sprigs to garnish
instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a non-stick pan, add cinnamon, cloves, black peppercorns, bay leaf, dried red chillies, green cardamoms and ginger-garlic paste, mix and sauté till fragrant. Add onion puree, mix and sauté till golden brown.
2. Add yogurt, mix well and saute for 2 minutes. Add cashewnut paste, mix and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Add 1½ cups water, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.
3. Add salt, sugar and red chilli powder and mix well. Add green capsicum, yellow capsicum, red capsicum and mix well.
4. Add cottage cheese cubes, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add rose water, mix well and take the pan off the heat.
5. Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish it with coriander sprig and serve hot.

name: Kanch Kolar Bora Recipe
ingredients: Raw bananas boiled 2, Medium potatoes boiled and peeled 2, Small onion finely chopped 1, Green chillies finely chopped 2, Salt to taste, Poppy seeds 1 teaspoon, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 4 teaspoons, Egg white 1/2, Oil to shallow fry, Tomato ketchup to serve
instructions:
1. Peel the bananas and put them in a bowl, add potatoes and mash them all together with your hand ensuring that there are no lumps. Add onion, green chillies, salt and poppy seeds and mix well. Add coriander leaves and mix well. Add egg white and mix well.
2. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick shallow frying pan.
3. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into balls and flatten them slightly.
4. Place these boras in the pan and shallow-fry on medium heat, turning sides, till golden brown and crisp on both sides
5. Transfer the boras on a serving platter and serve hot with tomato ketchup.

name: Dimer Dalna Recipe
ingredients: Eggs hard boiled and peeled 4, Large potato boiled and peeled 1, Oil 5 tablespoons, Bay leaves 2, Cinnamon sticks 2 inch, Green cardamoms 3, Black peppercorns 4-5, Cloves 2-3, Cumin seeds 1 teaspoon, Ginger-garlic paste 1 1/2 teaspoons, Onion paste 1/2 cup, Cumin powder 1/4 teaspoon, Coriander powder 1/2 teaspoon, Turmeric powder 1/4 teaspoon, Red Chilli powder 1/2, Tomato puree 1 cup, Salt to taste, Sugar 1 pinch, Green chillies finely chopped 2-3, Fresh coriander leaves chopped to garnish
instructions:
1. Heat a non-stick pan and add 3 tbsps oil.
2. Cut potato into 8 pieces, add to the pan and shallow-fry on high heat till golden brown.
3. Meanwhile make small slits on the eggs without cutting through.
4. Drain potato pieces into a bowl. Add eggs to the oil remaining in the pan, sprinkle a little salt and shallow-fry till golden brown. Drain into the same bowl.
5. Heat remaining oil in the same pan, add bay leaves, cinnamon, green cardamoms, peppercorns and cloves, mix and sauté on medium heat till fragrant.
6. Add cumin seeds, mix and sauté till their colour changes. Add ginger garlic paste, mix and sauté for 2 minutes or till raw smells disappear. Add onion paste, mix and saute on high heat for 2-3 minutes or till oil separates from mixture.
7. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder and red chilli powder, mix well and saute on low heat for 2 minutes.
8. Add tomato puree, mix well and saute till 2-3 minutes. Add ½ cup water and cook on medium heat for 2 minutes.
9. Add salt and sugar, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes on medium heat. Add fried eggs and potatoes, mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes or till the potatoes or eggs are fully cooked.  Add green chillies and cook on high heat for 2 minutes.
10. Transfer egg gravy into a serving bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Bengali Kosha Mangsho
ingredients: Mutton on bone, cut into pieces 750 grams, yogurt ½ cup, Garlic paste 2 tablespoons, Ginger paste 2 tablespoons, Cumin powder 1 teaspoon, Coriander powder 1½ teaspoons, Garam masala powder 1 teaspoon, Mustard oil 1 tablespoon, Onion finely chopped 1 large, Green chillies slit, 2 + for garnishing, Fresh tomato puree 1 cup, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoon, Sugar 1 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Potato peeled and cut into half 1 large
instructions:
1. Take mutton in a bowl. Add yogurt, 1 tablespoon garlic paste, 1 tablespoon ginger paste, ½ teaspoon cumin powder, 1 teaspoon coriander powder and ½ teaspoon garam masala powder and mix well. Refrigerate overnight.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pressure cooker till it reaches smoking point. Add onion and saute till it turns golden. Add remaining garlic paste and ginger paste, mix well and saute.
3. Add green chillies, mix and saute. Add tomato puree, mix well and saute for 3-4 minutes.
4. Add remaining coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder and red chilli powder, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add marinated mutton and mix well. Add ¼ cup water and mix well.
6. Add sugar and salt, mix well and cook on medium heat for 10-15 minutes.
7. Add potato, ¼ cup water and mix well. Cover and pressure cook for 5 whistles.
8. Serve hot garnished with slit green chilli.

name: Aamer Tok
ingredients: Raw mangoes peeled and cut into cubes 2-3 medium, Mustard oil 2-3 tablespoons, Mustard seeds 1 teaspoon, Dried red chillies 3, Turmeric powder ¼ teaspoon, Castor sugar (caster sugar) ½ cup, Salt to taste, Paanch phoran: Fennel seeds (saunf) 1 teaspoon, black sesame seeds (kale til) 1 teaspoon, Fenugreek seeds (methi dana) 1 teaspoon, Cumin seeds 1 teaspoon, Mustard seeds 1 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Heat mustard oil in a non-stick pan till it reaches the smoking point. Then cool it down to room temperature.
2. Grind together the spices in paanchphoran into a coarse powder.
3. Heat mustard oil again, add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add red chillies, turmeric powder and saute for half a minute.
4. Add raw mangoes, mix well and cook till mangoes turn soft and pulpy.
5. Add castor sugar and salt, mix well. Add ½ cup water, mix well and cook for 5-10 minutes.
6. Sprinkle ground paanchphoran on top and serve chilled.

name: Fish Paturi
ingredients: Basa fillets cut into 2 inch pieces 400 grams, Scraped coconut ½ cup, Banana leaves cut into 6 inch squares 3, Mustard powder 1 tablespoons, Poppy seeds (khuskhus/posto) soaked 2 tablespoons, Green chillies 3, Fresh coriander chopped 2 tablespoons, Turmeric powder 1 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Mustard oil 2 teaspoons, Juice of 1 lemon
instructions:
1. Take the mustard powder in a bowl. Add six tablespoons water and set aside.
2. In a blender, blend together coconut, poppy seeds, green chillies and coriander to a smooth paste.
3. Mix the blended mixture with the mustard paste. Add turmeric, salt and mustard oil, mix well.
4. In another bowl marinate the fish with salt and lemon juice. Add the marinade and mix well.
5. Heat water for boiling in a steamer.
6. Take a piece of banana leaf and place a piece of marinated fish on it. Cover it from all sides and tie it with a thread.
7. Place these on a steamer tray and steam it for seven to eight minutes. Serve hot.

name: Tamatar Ki Chutney
ingredients: Tomatoes finely chopped 4-5, Green chillies finely chopped 2 teaspoons, Oil 2 teaspoons, Salt to taste, Red chilli powder ½ teaspoon, Sugar ½ cup, Paanch phoran: Fenugreek seeds (methi dana) ¼ teaspoon, Onion seeds (kalonji) ¼ teaspoon, Fennel seeds (saunf) ¼ teaspoon, Cumin seeds ¼ teaspoon, Carom seeds (ajwain) a pinch
instructions:
1. Mix together all the ingredients of paanch phoran.
2. Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add paanch phoran and sauté for 2 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes and sauté for 2 minutes. Add salt, cover and cook for 5-7 minutes.
4. Add green chillies and red chilli powder, mix well and cook for 2 minutes.
5. Add sugar, mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes.
6. Serve hot or chilled

name: Pyazi Recipe Card
ingredients: Onions 4-5 medium, Gram flour (besan) 10 tablespoons, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoons, Turmeric powder 1/4 teaspoon, Cumin powder 1/2 teaspoon, Carom seeds (ajwain) 1/2 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 tablespoon, Fresh mint leaves chopped 1 tablespoon, Chaat masala 1 teaspoon, Rice flour 2 tablespoons, Oil 1 tablespo
instructions:
1. Roughly chop onions and transfer into a bowl.
2. Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, carom seeds, salt, chopped coriander, chopped mint, 1 teaspoon chaat masala, gram flour, rice flour and 1 tablespoon oil. Mix well using sufficient water to make a thick mixture.
3. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai.
4. Damp your palms and divide onion mixture into large equal portions shaped into balls (pyazi). Deep-fry pyazi in hot oil till half done. Drain on absorbent paper.
5. Apply some oil on the worktop and flatten half-fried pyazis, one by one. Reheat the oil again and deep-fry these flattened pyazis till crisp and golden. Drain on absorbent paper.
6. Transfer pyazis on a serving plate, sprinkle chaat masala on top and serve hot.

name: Khus Khus Kheer
ingredients: Poppy seeds (khuskhus or posto) soaked overnight and drained 1/2 cup, Milk 2 tablespoons + 2 cups, Rice 4 tablespoons, Saffron a large pinch, Sugar 1/3 cup, Green cardamom powder a pinch, Blanched and sliced almonds for garnishing, Blanched and sliced pistachios for garnishing
instructions:
1. Grind poppy seeds with 3 tbsps rice and 2 tbsps milk into a smooth paste.
2. Heat 2 cups milk in a deep non-stick pan, add remaining rice and saffron, mix and bring to a boil.
3. Add ground paste, mix well and cook, stirring continuously, for 4-5 minutes.
4. Add sugar, mix well and cook till it thickens and rice and poppy seeds are fully cooked.
5. Add cardamom powder and mix well and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
6. Serve hot garnished with almond and pistachio slices.

name: Charmuri Recipe
ingredients: Puffed Rice 8 cups, Coconut Oil 3 tablespoons, Green chillies chopped 2, Curry leaves 8-10, Onions chopped 2 medium, Salt to taste, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoon, Turmeric powder a pinch, roasted chana 1/4 cup, Roasted peanuts 1/4 cup, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 4 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Heat coconut oil in a non stick pan, add green chillies and curry leaves and sauté for half a minute and then add to puffed rice kept in a bowl.
2. Add onions, salt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, roasted chana, peanuts, one tablespoon coriander leaves and mix well.
3. Transfer into a serving bowl, sprinkle remaining coriander leaves and serve immediately.

name: Kesari Sandesh Recipe
ingredients: Cottage Cheese a large pinch, Milkmaid 500 grams, Milkmaid 1 cup (400gms), Refined flour 10 grams, Milk powder 300 grams, Powdered sugar 20 grams
instructions:
1. Cut cottage cheese into small chunks and place in a food processor. Add 1 cup Milkmaid, refined flour, milk powder and powdered sugar and blend well.
2. Heat a non-stick pan. Transfer cottage cheese mixture in it, mix well and cook till thick, stirring continuously.
3. Transfer the mixture into an aluminium tray and spread evenly. Smoothen the surface with a spatula.
4. Heat 3 tbsps water till warm. Add saffron and let the flavours infuse. Add 4 tbsps Milkmaid and heat further.
5. Add saffron mixture in the aluminium tray and spread evenly. Cool to room temperature and refrigerate for 2-3 hours.
6. Cut into squares and serve.

name: Aaloor Dam Recipe
ingredients: Baby Potatoes 500 grams, Tomatoes chopped 4 small, Ginger chopped 2 inch piece, Mustard oil 4 tablespoons, Cumin seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Green cardamoms 2, Cinnamon 1 inch stick, Whole dry red chillies 3, Bay leaves 2, Asafoetida a pinch, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoon, Cumin powder 1/2 teaspoon, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Sugar 1/2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Wash and boil potatoes. Cool and peel them. Heat mustard oil in a pan to smoking point.
2. Cool and heat again. Add cumin seeds, green cardamoms, cinnamon, red chillies, bay leaves, asafoetida and ginger and sauté for a couple of minutes.
3. Add red chilli powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, salt and sugar and sauté for a minute more.
4. Add tomatoes and potatoes. Mix well. Cover and cook for a couple of minutes. Serve hot with puris or chapatis.

name: Kacha Kolar Dalna Recipe
ingredients: Raw bananas 4 medium, Ginger 2 inch piece, Garlic 6-8 cloves, Gram flour (besan) 2 tablespoons, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1/4 cup, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Oil 1 tablespoon, Bay leaf 1, Onion grated 1 large, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Tomato chopped 1 medium, Garam masala powder 1/2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Grind ginger garlic to a smooth paste.Boil raw bananas and peel once cooled. Mash thoroughly.
2. Mix mashed bananas, gram flour, chopped coriander leaves, one teaspoon of the fresh ginger-garlic paste, half the red chilli powder and salt to taste.
3. Knead to a dough and divide into ten to twelve equal portions. Shape them into round koftas.
4. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai and deep fry koftas on medium heat till golden brown.
5. Drain and place on absorbent paper. Heat one tablespoon of oil in a pan, add bay leaf and grated onion.
6. Sauté till onion turns translucent and add remaining ginger-garlic paste and stir-fry briefly.
7. Add remaining red chilli powder, turmeric powder, tomato and cook on low heat, stirring continuously till oil separates.
8. Add two cups of water and salt to taste and bring the gravy to a boil. Reduce heat and add fried koftas. Simmer for five minutes. Stir in the garam masala powder and serve hot.

name: Aloo Posto Recipe
ingredients: Potatoes 5-6 medium, Poppy seeds soaked 4 tablespoons, Mustard oil 2 teaspoons, Onion seeds (kalonji) 1/2 teaspoon, Green chillies 2, Salt to taste, Sugar 1/2 teaspoon, Pure ghee 1/2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Heat mustard oil in a non stick pan till it smokes. Switch off heat.
2. Cut potatoes into ½ inch cubes. Drain and grind khus khus to a fine paste.
3. Heat the mustard oil again, add onion seeds and sauté till fragrant. Add potatoes and mix well. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
4. Add khus khus paste and mix. Cover and cook again till the potatoes are done.
5. Slit green chillies. Add salt, sugar and green chillies and mix. Add ½ cup water and mix. Simmer for a minute.
6. Add ghee and serve hot.

name: Pantua Recipe
ingredients: Paneer (cottage cheese) grated 250 grams, Mawa (khoya) grated 150 grams, Sugar 2 cup, Refined flour (maida) sieved 3 tablespoons, Green cardamom powder 1/2 teaspoon, Oil to deep fry, Rose water 1/2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Mix sugar with three and half cups of water and make a syrup over low heat. Mix paneer and khoya into a smooth dough.
2. Gradually add flour and green cardamom powder and knead well into a soft dough. Divide into fifteen oblong portions. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai and fry the pieces, two at a time, very carefully, till evenly browned.
3. Place sugar syrup on low heat to warm it up. Add rose water Soak the fried pantuas in it for at least half an hour. Serve either hot or cold.

name: Labra Recipe
ingredients: Cabbage shredded 100 grams, Mustard oil 1 tablespoon, Sweet potatoes 1 inch pieces 2 medium, White radish 1 inch pieces 2 medium, Red pumpkin (bhopla/kaddu) 1 inch pieces 100 grams, French beans 1 inch pieces 15, Brinjals 1 inch pieces 2, Potato 1 inch pieces 1 large, Broad beans (sem ki phalli/papdi) 1 inch pieces 15, Panch phoran 1/2 teaspoon, Whole dry red chillies 3, Turmeric powder 1 teaspoon, Ginger paste 1 teaspoon, Green chillies slit 2, Salt to taste, Sugar 3/4 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Heat oil and add paanch phoron and whole red chilies.
2. When they change colour, add all the vegetables and stir.
3. Add turmeric powder and ginger paste and mix well.
4. Cover and cook over low heat till all the vegetables are cooked.
5. Increase the heat so that all the moisture is dried up.
6. Add salt, sugar and slit green chilies and mix well.
7. Cook for two minutes and take the pan off the heat. 
Serve hot.

name: Posto Kheer Recipe
ingredients: Poppy seeds (khuskhus/posto) 10 tablespoons, Ghee 6 tablespoons, Milk 6 cups, Sugar 8 teaspoons, Green cardamom powder 2 teaspoons, Almonds chopped 1 tablespoon, Cashewnuts chopped 1 tablespoon, Raisins 1 tablespoon, Chironji 1 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Soak the poppy seeds in water overnight.
2. Drain and grind into a fine paste.
3. Heat ghee in a non stick pan, add the paste and sauté till brown.
4. Add milk and bring the mixture to a boil and cook till the mixture thickens.
5. Add sugar and cook for five minutes.
6. Add green cardamom powder, almonds, cashewnuts, raisins and chironji and mix well.
7. Serve hot or cold.

name: Shaag Begun Borir Ghonto
ingredients: Spinach Leaves shredded 2 bunches, Brinjal cut into 1 inch cubes 2, Bori (Bengali wadi) 10-12, Oil 1 tablespoon, Fennel seeds (saunf) 1 teaspoon, Cumin seeds 1 teaspoon, Mustard seeds 1 teaspoon, Onion chopped 1 medium, Ginger-garlic paste 1 teaspoon, Salt to taste
instructions:
1. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai and deep-fry boris till golden. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside. In the same oil, deep-fry brinjal cubes till golden. Drain on absorbent paper and set aside.
2. Heat one tablespoon oil in a non-stick pan, add fennel seeds, cumin seeds, mustard seeds and let the seeds splutter. Add onion and sauté till it becomes translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and saute for a minute.
3. Add spinach, fried boris, fried brinjal and salt. Mix well, cover and cook for a few minutes or till the spinach wilts. Serve hot.

name: Ilish Machcher Sorse Jhol Recipe
ingredients: Hilsa Fish 8 half-inch thick slices, Mustard 2 tablespoons, Salt to taste, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Green chillies 4, Mustard oil 4 tablespoons, Red chilli powder 3/4 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Grind mustard seeds, salt, turmeric powder, 2 green chillies with a little water. 
Transfer the paste into a bowl, add fish slices and mix well.
2. Add 2 tbsps mustard oil and mix.
Heat the remaining oil in a non stick pan till it smokes and take it off heat.
3. Heat it again, add the fish pieces and sauté for 2-3 minutes. 
Turn over and sauté the other side too.
4. Slit the remaining 2 green chillies and add with 1 cup water and mix.
Add red chilli powder and mix.
5. Add 1 cup water to the mustard paste remaining in the bowl and add to the pan. 
Cover and cook till fish is just done.Serve hot with boiled rice.

name: Mishti Doi Recipe
ingredients: Milk 2 litres, Sugar 2 tablespoons, Seedless dates 8-10, Yogurt 1 tablespoon
instructions:
1. Boil milk in a deep non stick pan on low heat, stirring continuously, till it reduces to half.
2. Add sugar and stir to dissolve it.
3. Take the pan off the heat.
4. Boil dates in ½ cup water till soft.
5. Cool and puree.
6. Transfer the milk into a large bowl and let it become lukewarm.
7. Add date puree and mix well.
8. Add homemade yogurt and mix well.
9. Pour into individual earthenware bowls and keep in warm place to set.
10. Take care not to shake the bowls.
11. Once set you can chill in the refrigerator.
12. Serve chilled.

name: Tomato Chaatni Recipe
ingredients: Tomatoes chopped 8 medium, Seedless dates 8-10, Sugar 1 cup, Oil 2 tablespoons, Cumin seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Fenugreek seeds (methi dana) 1/2 teaspoon, Mustard seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Fennel seeds (saunf) 1/2 teaspoon, Onion seeds (kalonji) 1/2 teaspoon, Dried red chillies broken 2, Salt to taste, Tamarind pulp 1 tablespoon
instructions:
1. Heat 1 cup water in a non-stick pan, add sugar and cook to make a thin syrup.
2. Heat oil in a deep non stick pan, add ¼ tsp each of cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, fennel seeds and onion seeds and sauté till fragrant.
3. Dry roast all the remaining seeds till fragrant. 
Add tomatoes to the deep pan and stir.
4. Add broken red chillies and mix. 
Cover and cook for some time.
5. Put the roasted spices in a mortar and pound to a coarse powder.
Add salt to tomatoes and mix. Add the sugar syrup and mix.
6. Chop dates and add and mix well. 
Cook till tomatoes are soft.
7. Add tamarind pulp and mix and cook till the tomatoes are completely mashed and the chutney thick. 
Transfer into a serving bowl, sprinkle the spice powder and serve.

name: Jhinge Posto Recipe
ingredients: Ridge gourd (turai) peeled and cut into 1/2 inch cubes 400 grams, Poppy seed paste (khuskhus) soaked 2 tablespoons, Oil 2 tablespoons, Cloves 2, Onions chopped 2 medium, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Green chillies slit 3, Pure ghee 2 teaspoons
instructions:
1. Heat oil in a non stick pan, add cloves and sauté.
2. Grind poppy seeds to a fine paste.
3. Add onions to the pan and sauté till lightly browned. Add ridge gourd, turmeric powder and salt and mix. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add ground paste and mix well. Cover and cook on medium heat. Add green chillies and mix and cook till gourd is done.
5. Drizzle pure ghee and serve hot.

name: Steamer Chicken Recipe
ingredients: Chicken cut into 12 pieces on the bone 700 grams, Yogurt 1 cup, Fennel seeds (saunf) 1 1/2 teaspoons, Poppy seeds (khuskhus/posto) 1 teaspoon, Oil 4 tablespoons, Salt to taste, Ginger paste 1 tablespoon, Garlic paste 1 tablespoon, Turmeric powder 3/4 teaspoon, Red chilli powder 1 1/2 teaspoons, Mustard oil 2 tablespoons, Vinegar 2 teaspoons, Potatoes quartered 2 large, Dried red chillies 2 tablespoons, Onions finely chopped 2 large, Cumin powder 1 1/2 teaspoons, Coriander seeds 2 cup, Fresh coriander leaves finely chopped 2 tablespoons, Garam masala powder 1/2 teaspoon, Ghee 1 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Dry roast coriander seeds, fennel seeds and poppy seeds till fragrant. Cool and grind to a powder.
2. Heat oil in a non stick pan. Marinate chicken with salt, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 tsp paste garlic paste, turmeric powder, ½ tsp red chilli powder, mustard oil, vinegar for 15 minutes.
3. Add potatoes to oil in the pan, cover and sauté till light golden. Drain and set aside.
4. Cut red chillies into small pieces and remove seeds.
5. Pour the oil remaining from sautéing potatoes into another non stick pan, add red chillies and onions and sauté till golden. Add remaining ginger paste, remaining garlic paste, cumin powder, remaining red chilli powder and sauté.
6. Add chicken and sauté on high heat for 3-5 minutes.
7. Mix yogurt and ground powder and add to the chicken and mix well. Add potatoes and mix. Add ½ cup water and mix. Cover and cook.
8. Chop coriander leaves and add and cook for 10-12 minutes or till the chicken is done.
9. Add garam masala powder and ghee and mix. Serve hot.

name: Chhenar Payesh Recipe
ingredients: Chenna 1/2 cup, Skimmed milk 1 litre, Sugar 1/2 cup, Almonds blanched peeled and chopped 5-6, Pistachios blanched peeled and chopped 7-8
instructions: 1. Boil milk, reduce heat and let it simmer till reduced to half the original quantity. Add sugar and cook till it dissolves. Mash chenna in a bowl. Add it to the milk. Simmer for two minutes. Garnish with nuts and serve cold.

name: Radha Bollobhi Recipe
ingredients: Refined flour (maida) 1 cup, Whole wheat flour (atta) 1 cup, Salt to taste, Oil for deep-frying, For stuffing: Split Bengal gram (chana dal) 3/4 cup, Salt to taste, Green cardamoms 4, Cumin seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Cinnamon 1/2 inch stick, Cloves 4, Dried red chillies 2, Ginger roughly chopped 1 inch piece
instructions:
1. Sift the flours with salt into a bowl. Add sufficient water and knead into a soft dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside for half an hour.
2. For the stuffing, drain and boil the dal in sufficient water till just done. Ensure that the dal grains do not get mashed. Drain completely and set aside.
3. Heat a non stick pan and dry roast green cardamoms, cumin seeds, cinnamon, cloves, red chillies and ginger and sauté till fragrant.
4. Cool and grind. Add the dal and salt and grind coarsely. The mixture should be dry.
5. Divide the dough into small lemon sized balls. Stuff each ball with a little of the stuffing mixture and roll into round balls. Apply a little oil and roll into small puris.
6. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Gently slide in the puris, one by one, and deep fry till golden on both sides. Drain on absorbent paper and serve hot with cholar dal.

name: Macher Kalia Recipe
ingredients: Rohu fish cut into darnes 500 grams, Mustard oil 4 tablespoons, Onions grated 2 medium, Salt to taste, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Cloves 3-4, Ginger chopped 1 teaspoon, Garlic chopped 1 teaspoon, Green chillies chopped 2, Red chilli powder 1/2 teaspoon, Tomato puree 2 tablespoons, Cumin powder 1 teaspoon, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Heat mustard oil in a non stick pan till it smokes. Squeeze the onions and discard excess water.
2. Add salt and turmeric powder to the fish pieces and mix well.
3. Cool the oil slightly, add the fish pieces and shallow fry on high heat, turning sides, till well cooked. Drain and place in a plate.
4. To the oil remaining in the pan add cloves and onions and sauté till browned. Add ginger and garlic and continue to sauté till fragrant.
5. Add green chillies, remaining turmeric powder and red chilli powder and mix. Add tomato puree and sauté till oil begins to separate.
6. Add 1½ cups water and cumin powder and mix well. Add salt and mix. Add fried fish and coriander leaves and cook on low heat for 2-3 minutes.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Aloo Posto Recipe
ingredients: Potatoes 5-6 medium, Poppy seeds soaked 4 tablespoons, Mustard oil 2 teaspoons, Onion seeds (kalonji) 1/2 teaspoon, Green chillies 2, Salt to taste, Sugar 1/2 teaspoon, Pure ghee 1/2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Heat mustard oil in a non stick pan till it smokes. Switch off heat.
2. Cut potatoes into ½ inch cubes. Drain and grind khus khus to a fine paste.
3. Heat the mustard oil again, add onion seeds and sauté till fragrant. Add potatoes and mix well. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
4. Add khus khus paste and mix. Cover and cook again till the potatoes are done.
5. Slit green chillies. Add salt, sugar and green chillies and mix. Add ½ cup water and mix. Simmer for a minute.
6. Add ghee and serve hot.

name: Fig And Apricot Sandesh Recipe
ingredients: Figs soaked 8-10, Golden apricots soaked 8-10, Sugar 1 tablespoon, Paneer (cottage cheese) 400 grams, Powdered sugar 1/2 cup, Saffron (kesar) a few strands, Pistachios blanched and peeled 16-20
instructions:
1. Drain the figs and apricots and put them in a pan. Add one cup water, one tablespoon sugar and cook on medium heat till soft.
2. Mash the chenna well with your palms. Add powdered sugar and mash some more. Soak saffron in a little warm water.
3. Divide chenna into sixteen to twenty equal sized balls and arrange them on a plate. Press a few saffron strands on each ball and place a pistachio over the saffron.
4. Place the stewed figs and apricots on a serving plate.
5. Place a chenna ball on each and serve.

name: Mishti Alurpuli Recipe
ingredients: Sweet potatoes boiled and peeled and grated 1 kilogram, Sugar, Sugar 2 1/4 cups, Coconut scraped 2 1/4 cups, Milk thickened 6 tablespoons, Refined flour (maida) 4-5 tablespoons, Ghee to deep fry
instructions:
1. Heat one and three-quarter cups of sugar with one cup of water to make a syrup of soft ball consistency. Keep warm.
2. Heat a pan. Add coconut and roast for two to three minutes. Add thickened milk and remaining sugar and cook, stirring till dry and lightly browned. Set aside to cool.
3. Take grated sweet potatoes in a bowl. Add refined flour and knead into a pliable dough.
4. Divide the coconut mixture and the sweet potato into sixteen portions each. Stuff each sweet potato portion with coconut mixture and shape into oblong croquettes. These are pulis.
5. Heat sufficient ghee in a kadai and deep fry these pulis on medium heat till golden. Drain and dip them in the syrup for fifteen to twenty minutes.
6. Serve at room temperature.

name: Mooger Puli Recipe
ingredients: Split green gram 1 cup, Sweet potatoes, Sweet potatoes 3 medium, Ghee 3 tablespo, Rice flour 2 tablespoons, Jaggery (gur) 3/4 cup, Green cardamom powder 1/2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Dry roast dhuli moong dal till lightly browned. Boil the sweet potatoes. Drain, cool, peel and mash.
2. Add two cups of hot water to the roasted dal and cook till done. Drain any excess water.
3. Heat three tablespoons of ghee in a pan and add the cooked dal and sauté. Add rice flour and jaggery. Mix and cook stirring continuously till the jaggery melts completely. Add mashed sweet potatoes and mix. Continue to cook till dry.
4. Transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool. Add green cardamom powder and mix.
5. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into small cylindrical shaped pulis.
6. Heat sufficient ghee in a kadai and deep fry the pulis for one to two minutes or till golden brown. Drain and place on absorbent paper.
7. Serve hot.

name: Rose Sandesh Recipe
ingredients: Milk 2 litres, Rose water a few drops, Whey (to curdle milk) 1 cup, Sugar substitute sucralose 1 cup, Pistachios blanched 15-20
instructions:
1. Take cow’s milk in a deep pan and bring it to a boil.
2. Reduce heat, add whey and keep stirring till the milk curdles completely.
3. Strain through a muslin cloth and immediately place the muslin potli on ice to stop the cooking process.
4. Squeeze to remove the excess moisture.

name: Bhapa Doi With Tofu
ingredients: Silken beancurd 1/2 inch cubes 100 grams, Condensed milk, Condensed milk 1 tin, Thick yogurt whisked 1/2 cup, Milk 1/2 cup, Green cardamom powder 1/2 teaspoon, Saffron (kesar) dissolved in 1 tbsp of milk a few strands, Pistachios blanched and sliced 15
instructions:
1. Blend together yogurt and beancurd till smooth. Add a little milk and blend again.
2. Pour the mixture into a bowl. Add condensed milk and mix well. Add green cardamom powder and saffron milk and mix well.
3. Pour the mixture into a silicon bowl and sprinkle pistachios over. Cover and steam in a steamer for twenty to twenty five minutes.
4. Cool to room temperature and then chill in the refrigerator.
5. Serve chilled.

name: Sorshe Bata Ilish Recipe
ingredients: Hilsa fish ½ inch thick darnes 1 medium, Mustard seeds 1/2 cup, Salt to taste, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Green chillies 2, Oil 4 tablespoons, Potato cut into fingers 1 large, Onion seeds (kalonji) 1/4 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Wash fish pieces and marinate with salt and turmeric powder and set aside for ten to fifteen minutes. Grind mustard seeds with green chillies to a fine paste using water as required.
2. Heat oil in a pan and lightly fry the marinated fish pieces on both sides till lightly browned.
3. Drain and set aside on a plate. In the same oil fry the potato fingers till lightly browned. Drain and set aside.
4. In the remaining oil add onion seeds and sauté till fragrant. Add the ground paste and sauté for a minute. Add a cup of water and bring it to a boil. Add turmeric powder and salt. Add potato fingers and simmer till they are done. Add fish, cover and simme
5. Serve hot with boiled rice.

name: Bengali Banana Chop Recipe
ingredients: Banana flower 1 medium, Potatoes, Poppy seeds (khuskhus/posto) 1 tablespoon, Onions 2 large, Green chillies 3-4, Potatoes boiled and mashed 2 medium, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 1 cup, Salt to taste, Sugar 2 teaspoons, Black pepper powder 1 teaspoon, Vinegar 2 teaspoons, Oil to deep fry
instructions:
1. Remove outer part of the banana flower, separate the inner white flowers, remove the hard inner stalk and the outer skin. Chop the thin white flowers and soak in water for two hours to remove the stickiness and bitterness.
2. Soak the poppy seeds in two tablespoons of water for an hour and grind to a smooth paste. Chop the onions and green chillies in the chopper. Add to the mashed potatoes. Add coriander leaves. Squeeze the chopped banana flowers so that all the water is remo
3. Heat sufficient oil in a non-stick pan. Shape the mixture into oval shaped chops and deep fry till crisp and golden. Drain onto an absorbent paper.
4. Serve hot.

name: Chorchori Recipe
ingredients: Potatoes separated into florets 1/4 medium, Red pumpkin 1/2 inch pieces 2 medium, Sweet potato 1/2 inch pieces 1 medium, Red pumpkin (bhopla/kaddu) 1/2 inch pieces 100 grams, French beans 1/2 inch pieces 15, Brinjals 1/2 inch pieces 2, Potato 1/2 inch pieces 1 large, Broad beans (sem ki phalli/papdi) 1 inch pieces 15, Mustard oil 3 tablespoons, Panch phoran 1 1/2 teaspoons, Turmeric powder 1/4 teaspoon, Green chillies slit 2, Sugar 1/2 teaspoon, Salt to taste
instructions:
1. Heat two tablespoons of mustard oil in a pan till it just reaches smoking point.
2. Remove, cool and heat the oil again on medium heat. Add panch phoron and when it starts crackling, add red chilli powder, stir briefly and add the prepared vegetables. Stir and add turmeric powder, slit green chillies, sugar and salt to taste.
3. Reduce heat, cover and cook for eight to ten minutes, stirring occasionally or till potato pieces are cooked.
4. Add remaining mustard oil and stir-fry for one minute and or till chorchori is dry.

name: Daab Chingri Recipe
ingredients: Prawns 1 cup, Tender Coconut, Tender coconut 1 small, Salt to taste, Turmeric powder 1/4 teaspoon, Mustard oil 1 tablespoon, Panch phoran 1/2 teaspoon, Onions sliced 2 medium, Ginger paste 1/2 teaspoon, Garlic paste 1 1/2 teaspoons, Green chillies slit 4-5, Coconut scraped 1/4 cup, Tender coconut flesh (malai) chopped 1/4 cup, Whole wheat flour (atta) dough as required
instructions:
1. Cut off an inch from the top of the tender coconut, drain the water and scoop out the flesh. Retain the top to act as a lid.
2. Preheat oven to 220°C. Add salt and turmeric powder to the prawns. Mix and set aside. Heat mustard oil to smoking point. Cool slightly and add paanch phoron.
3. When the seeds splutter add onions and sauté. Add ginger and garlic pastes, green chillies and coconut and continue to sauté for two minutes.
4. Add one cup of water and stir. Add prawns and stir. Add coconut flesh and adjust salt. Transfer the mixture into tender coconut shell. Cover with the lid and seal with dough.
5. Place in the preheated oven and cook for about twenty minutes.
6. Open the lid and serve hot.

name: Chhenna Murki Recipe
ingredients: Paneer 1/2 inch 250 grams, Sugar 1 cup, Milk 1 tablespoon, Kewra essence 2-3 drops, Icing sugar as required
instructions:
1. For the syrup, cook the sugar with one cup of water, stirring continuously, till the sugar dissolves.
2. Add the milk. Collect the scum, which rises to the surface with a ladle, and discard. Cook the syrup till it attains a one-string consistency.
3. Add the cottage cheese and cook till the syrup coats the cubes well.
4. Remove from heat, add the screw pine essence and mix well. Keep swirling the pan till the cubes are thickly coated with the syrup and separated from each other.
5. Arrange in a serving plate and sprinkle liberally with icing sugar.

name: Aloo Luchi Recipe
ingredients: Potatoes boiled, peeled and mashed 2 medium, Refined Flour 2 cups, Ghee 1 tablespoon, Salt to taste, Oil to deep fry
instructions:
1. Mix together potatoes, refined flour, ghee and salt in a parat. Add sufficient water and knead into dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside for 10-15 minutes.
2. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. Divide dough into small equal portions and roll them into balls. Apply a little oil on the balls and roll them out into small puris or luchis.
3. Deep fry luchis, turning sides, till equally done on both sides, ensuring they do not get coloured. Drain on absorbent paper. Transfer into a serving plate and serve hot.

name: Cholar Dal Recipe
ingredients: Split Bengal gram (chana dal) soaked 1 1/4 cups, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Sugar 1 tablespoon, Salt to taste, Ghee 1 tablespoon, Fresh coconut cut into 1/2 inch thick slices 1/4, Cloves 6-8, Cinnamon 1 inch stick, Black cardamoms 4, Cumin seeds 1 teaspoon, Dried red chillies broken 3, Green chillies roughly chopped 2-3, Raisins 2 tablespoons, Ginger paste 1 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Heat 4 cups water in a deep non stick pan. Add chana dal, ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tbsp sugar and salt, cover and cook till the dal is cooked.
2. Heat ghee in another non stick pan, add coconut slices and fry till golden. Drain on absorbent paper.
3. Add cloves, cinnamon, black cardamoms, cumin seeds, dried red chillies, green chillies and raisins to the ghee remaining in the pan and sauté.
4. Add chana dal and ginger paste and mix well. Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes or till the dal thickens. Add half the fried coconut slices and mix well.
5. Transfer into a serving bowl, garnish with remaining coconut slices and serve hot.

name: Sandesh Recipe
ingredients: Milk 8 cups, Castor Sugar 1/2 cup, Lemon juice 1/4 cup, Green cardamom powder as required, Pistachios blanched and chopped 12
instructions:
1. Bring the milk to a boil in a deep, thick-bottomed non-stick pan. Add the lemon juice and stir till the milk curdles. Strain and immediately refresh the chhenna in chilled water.
2. Put the chhenna in a piece of muslin and squeeze till all the water is drained out.
3. Knead the chhenna well with the heel of your hand. Add caster sugar and cardamom powder, and knead again.
4. Cook in a non-stick pan on medium heat for eight minutes. Remove from heat and divide into twelve equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball and make a dent on the top.
5. When cooled, place a pistachio in the dent and serve.
Makes 12 sandesh/350 grams

name: Bhapa Ilish Recipe
ingredients: Hilsa 1 kilogram, Yellow Mustad Seeds, Salt to taste, Turmeric powder 1 teaspoon, Yellow mustard seeds 1 teaspoon, Mustard seeds 1 teaspoon, Green chillies 2-3, Ginger 1 inch piece, Mustard oil 3 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Wash the fish well and clean it from inside. Cut into darne. Sprinkle salt and half of the turmeric powder. Make a smooth paste of yellow mustard seeds, black mustard seeds, green chillies, ginger and salt.
2. Take a pressure cooker. Add three cups of water and place a ring in it.
3. Take a pan and place the fish in it and place the pan on the ring in the pressure cooker. Add remaining turmeric powder to prepared paste.
4. Apply paste liberally on fish. Pour mustard oil on top. Adjust seasoning. Cover with lid and steam for eight to ten minutes. Serve hot.

name: Doi Mach Recipe
ingredients: Rohu Fish cut into 1 inch thick slices 600 grams, Yogurt, Yogurt 1 cup, Salt to taste, Ghee 2 tablespoons, Bay leaves 2, Cloves 4-6, Green cardamoms 3-4, Onions grated 2 small, Green chillies slit 3
instructions:
1. Whisk yogurt, add salt and marinade fish in this for twenty minutes.
2. Heat ghee in a kadai and add bay leaves, cloves and green cardamoms. Cook for fifteen seconds.
3. Add grated onions. Sauté for five to seven minutes. Add slit green chillies and fish along with the yogurt. Bring to a boil.
4. Cover and cook on a low heat for seven to eight minutes.

name: Belghoria Roshun Bhetki Recipe
ingredients: Fish Fillets 400 grams, Yogurt 1 cup, Garlic paste 1 1/2 tablespoons, Ghee 3 tablespoons, Salt to taste, Black peppercorns 20-25, Ginger paste 1/2 teaspoon, Tomato puree 1 teaspoon, Coconut milk 1/2 cup, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Cashewnut paste 2 tablespoons, Fresh cream 2 teaspoons, Fresh coriander leaves finely chopped 1 tablespoon, Cashewnuts chopped a few
instructions:
1. Cut into fish into small cubes. Marinate them with yogurt and garlic paste for 15-20 minutes. Heat ghee in a non stick pan.
2. Add salt, black peppercorns and the marinated fish pieces without the marinade. Saute till the fish gets almost cooked.
3. Add ginger paste and tomato puree and mix well. Add coconut milk and mix lightly.Add a pinch of turmeric powder to cashewnut paste and mix. Add this to the fish gravy.
4. Remove the pan from heat, add the remaining fish marinade, mix and keep it covered for 2-3 minutes. Add fresh cream and mix well. Garnish with coriander leaves and cashewnuts and serve hot.

name: Shukto Recipe
ingredients: Bitter Gourd Bitter gourd (karela) 1 medium, White Raddish 1 inch cubes 1 medium, Ridge gourd (turai) 1 inch cubes 1 medium, Sweet potatoes 1 inch cubes 1 medium, Potatoes 1 inch cubes 1 medium, Broad beans (sem ki phalli/papdi) 1 inch pieces 1 medium, Drumsticks 1 inch pieces 2, Eggplants/ brinjals 1 inch cubes 1 medium, Oil 5 tablespoons, Poppy seeds (khuskhus/posto) 2 tablespoons, Mustard seeds 1 teaspoon, Ginger 1 inch piece, Panch phoran 1 teaspoon, Bay leaves 2, Sugar 1 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Ghee 1 tablespoon
instructions:
1. Wash and cut the bitter gourd into thin roundels. Heat two tablespoons of oil in a pan and fry bitter gourd slices lightly. Drain and keep aside. Make a thick paste of poppy seeds, mustard seeds and ginger.
2. Heat the remaining oil in a kadai. Add panch phoron and bay leaves. When the seeds start to crackle, add the chopped vegetables and stir lightly.
3. Add the ground spices and stir for five to seven minutes. Add two cups of water and cover. Cook on medium heat stirring occasionally till vegetables are almost cooked.
4. Add the fried bitter gourd, salt and sugar. Stir and add a tablespoon of ghee. Cook for another two minutes till gravy is not too thick nor too dry. Serve hot.

name: Kathi Roll Recipe
ingredients: Refined Flour 4-6, Boneless Chicken 300 grams, Ginger paste 1/2 tablespoon, Garlic paste 1/2 tablespoon, Salt to taste, Oil 2 tablespoons, Roasted cumin powder 1/2 teaspoon, Coriander powder 1/2 teaspoon, Red chilli powder 1/2 teaspoon, Chaat masala 1/4 teaspoon, Onions sliced 2 medium, Carrot cut into thin strips 1 medium, Green chutney 4-6 tablespoons, Fresh coriander leaves chopped 2 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Mix ginger paste, garlic paste and salt and marinate chicken cubes in it for an hour preferably in the refrigerator. 
Heat oil in a pan and sauté chicken cubes till done.
2. Add roasted cumin powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, chaat masala and salt. 
Mix sliced onions and carrot strips.
3. To make kathi rolls, put one teaspoon of oil on a tawa and lightly heat the rotis. 
Smear each roti with one tablespoon of green chutney, place six to eight pieces of cooked chicken and sprinkle with remaining green chillies and coriander leaves.
4. Spread a spoonful of onion and carrot mixture on the roti and sprinkle salt.
5. Roll the roti tightly over the stuffing and serve.

name: Chennar Payesh Recipe
ingredients: Milk 1 1/2 litres, Saffron (kesar) a few strands, Lemon juice 1 1/2 tablespoon, Sugar 1/2 cup, Almonds blanched and chopped 5-6, Pistachios blanched and chopped 7-8
instructions:
1. Soak saffron in two tablespoons of warm milk and set aside. Boil half litre of milk. As it comes to a boil add lemon juice and keep stirring till all the milk curdles.
2. Strain the whey and tie up the chenna in a muslin cloth and dip in ice water till it cools completely. Then squeeze till all the liquid drains away. Set aside.
3. Boil milk, add a pinch of saffron, reduce heat and let it simmer till reduced to half the original quantity.
4. Add sugar, stir and simmer till it dissolves. Mash chenna in a bowl. Add it to the milk. Simmer for two minutes.
5. Add almonds and pistachios and the soaked saffron and take off the heat.
6. Cool and serve.

name: Kumror Chhokka Recipe
ingredients: Red pumpkin (bhopla/kaddu) peeled and cut into cubes 500 grams, Mustard oil 2 tablespoons, Cumin seeds 1 tablespoon, Ginger paste 1 teaspoon, Split Bengal gram (chana dal) soaked 1 tablespoon, Turmeric powder 1 teaspoon, Red chilli pepper 1 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Sugar to taste
instructions:
1. Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add cumin seeds. When their colour begins to change, add pumpkin and sauté for about five to seven minutes.
2. Add ginger paste and split Bengal gram, mix well and cook for a few minutes.
3. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, salt and sugar. Mix well, add three-fourth cup of water and cook till the water is absorbed and the pumpkin is cooked. Serve hot.

name: Aloo Bhaja Recipe
ingredients: Potatoes peeled 7-8 medium, Oil 6 tablespoons, Salt to taste, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Cut potatoes into thin strips and keep them soaked in water.
2. Heat oil in a non-stick pan.
3. Remove potatoes from water and lightly squeeze the extra water and put them in a bowl.
4. Add salt and turmeric powder and mix.
5. Add the potatoes to the pan and shallow-fry, stirring to ensure even cooking, till crisp and lightly browned.
6. Drain and place on absorbent paper.
7. Serve them hot in shot glasses.

name: Luchi Recipe
ingredients: Refined flour 2 cups, Ghee 1 teaspoon, Ghee 1 tablespoon, Oil for deep-frying
instructions:
1. Sieve the flour with salt. Add ghee and make soft dough with sufficient water.
2. Keep covered with a moist cloth for half an hour. Divide into twenty equal parts and make balls. Roll out each ball into three-inch diameter discs.
3. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai and fry the luchis till well puffed and cream coloured. Drain on absorbent paper. Serve hot with cholar dal or any curry of your choice.

name: Dal Chenchki
ingredients: Split red lentils 1 cup, Baby onions peeled 8-10, Cumin seeds 1/2 teaspoon, Desi ghee 2 tablespoons, Tomato chopped 1 medium, Red chilli powder 1 teaspoon, Turmeric powder 1/2 teaspoon, Salt to taste, Sugar 1/2 teaspoon, Panch phoran powdered 1/4 teaspoon
instructions:
1. Wash and soak dal in three cups of water for fifteen minutes. Drain, spread on a large thali or plate and leave it to dry. Heat ghee in a kadai. Add baby onions and fry lightly till brown. Add cumin seeds, chopped tomato, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, salt and cook the masala for few minutes.
2. Add the dal, sugar and panch phoron powder with two cups of water and continue cooking, covered on medium heat. Take care that the dal is not mashed but remains whole. It should be dry with practically no gravy. Serve hot.

name: Alutua Recipe
ingredients: Sweet potato boiled and mashed 3 medium, Sugar 1 cup, Refined flour (maida) 1/2 cup, Soda bicarbonate 1/2 teaspoon, Ghee 1 tablespoon, Raisins 12, Oil to deep fry
instructions:
1. Boil sugar with one cup of water till a syrup of one string consistency is formed. Keep it warm. Sieve refined flour with soda bicarbonate. Rub in ghee. Add this to the mashed sweet potatoes.
2. Knead well. In case the mixture feels soft, add a little more flour. Make twelve lemon sized balls and stuff one raisin in each. Heat sufficient oil in a kadai. When the oil begins to smoke, take off the heat, put in few balls at a time.
3. The oil begins to smoke, take off the heat, put in few balls at a time. Put on medium heat again and fry till golden brown. Drain and put the balls in the syrup and keep aside for two to three hours. Alutuas can be served hot as well as cold

name: Chum Chum Recipe
ingredients: Cow’s milk 10 cups, Chenna, Refined flour (maida) 1 tablespoon, Cornflour/ corn starch 1/2 teaspoon, Sugar 1.2 kilogram, Milk 2 tablespoons, Khoya/mawa 2 tablespoons, Rose water 1 teaspoon, Saffron (kesar) a few threads, Sugar syrup 1 tablespoon, Edible yellow colour a few drops, White vinegar 8 tablespoons
instructions:
1. Boil the milk on high heat. Set aside to cool slightly (77°C/170°F).
2. Mix the vinegar in one and three-fourth cups of water and add to the hot milk. Stir lightly till the milk curdles. Add three to four cups of cold water and a few ice cubes and stir.
3. Strain the chhenna through a piece of muslin and squeeze to remove all the water. You should have 250 grams of chhenna.
4. Transfer the chhenna onto a worktop. Mix together half a teaspoon of refined flour and the cornflour and add to the chhenna. Knead with the heel of your hands to a smooth mixture.
5. Divide the mixture into twenty-five equal portions and roll into oblong smooth rolls, taking care that there are no cracks. Make a small dent on one side and set aside.
6. Mix the remaining flour with half a cup of water and set aside.
7. To make the syrup, cook the sugar with five cups of water, stirring continuously till the sugar dissolves. Add the milk and let the syrup come to a boil.
